page.title: 07Wild Flora
page.content: At the top of our school field is an area of land that has been put aside as a{conservation area.}The grass is allowed to grow and few people walk there. This enables many species of {grass}and{flowers,}some of them rare ones, to grow there. The rarest flower in the area is the{Bee orchid}(Ophrys apifera). The appearance is of a female bee resting on the pink petals. This attracts a male bee who pollinates it. Other flowers include; slender speedwell (filiformis), dog rose (rosa canina), scentless mayweed (matricaria perforata), leafy hawkweed (hieracium umbellatum), small fleabane (pulicaria vulgaris). Daisies, buttercups, ferns and thistles grow there in abundance.
